alert.note: Alert for Lower Treasure Valley; Owyhee Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 6:25PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Ada, southeastern Canyon and northwestern Owyhee Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 625 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Reynolds, or 32 miles south of Nampa, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Murphy around 650 PM MDT. Swan Falls and Guffey around 700 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
